services.commercialLoanCtaTitle: Ready to take the next step?
services.commercialLoanCtaDescription: Connect with our commercial lending specialists to structure a deal that works for you.

step1.title: Search & Shortlist
step1.description: Discover us through our website and social media. Access blog posts, articles, and resources with valuable mortgage insights. We update interest rates weekly, allowing you to search and shortlist home loans.

step2.title: Expert Consultation
step2.description: Reach out for personalised advice and answers to your questions. Schedule a meeting with one of our experienced brokers to discuss your financial needs and goals.

step3.title: Application
step3.description: Ready to proceed? Complete and submit your application online. We'll handle all the paperwork for you.

step4.title: Tracking & Updating
step4.description: Stay informed with regular updates about your application status. We'll manage correspondence with the lender and keep you updated throughout the process.

step5.title: Closing
step5.description: We'll prepare all the necessary documents for you to review and sign. Receive your loan funds and complete your mortgage transaction smoothly.

step6.title: Post-Closing
step6.description: Our support continues even after closing. We offer ongoing assistance with tax, accounting, and insurance, and help you explore refinancing options or additional financial services as your needs evolve.

resources.loanPreparationIntroBody: Being well-prepared can significantly speed up your loan application process. Here is what you will need to have ready.

loanPreparationRequiredDocuments.identity: Proof of identity (driver's license or passport)

loanPreparationTips.tip1: Organize all documents before starting your application
loanPreparationTips.tip2: Be honest about your financial situation
loanPreparationTips.tip3: Ask questions if you are unsure about anything
loanPreparationTips.tip4: Work with our experts to find the best loan option

resources.loanPreparationConclusion: Need help preparing your loan application? Contact us today and our team will guide you through the process.

resources.stampDutyCalculatorOfficialDisclaimer: These calculators are provided and maintained by state governments to ensure you receive the most current and accurate stamp duty information.

faq.seoDescription: Frequently asked questions about mortgages and loans.
faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.intro: Find answers to common questions about mortgages and loans.

q1.question: What documents do I need to apply for a loan?
q1.answer: You will typically need proof of identity, proof of income (payslips, tax returns), bank statements, and details about the property you are purchasing. Our team can provide a complete checklist based on your specific situation.

q2.question: How long does the loan approval process take?
q2.answer: The approval process typically takes 2–4 weeks, depending on the complexity of your application and how quickly you can provide required documents. Pre-approval can often be obtained within 24–48 hours.

q3.question: What is the minimum deposit required?
q3.answer: Most lenders require a minimum deposit of 10–20% of the property value. However, some government programs may allow lower deposits for eligible first home buyers.

q4.question: Can I get a loan with a low credit score?
q4.answer: While a higher credit score improves your chances, we work with various lenders who may consider applications with lower credit scores. The interest rate and terms may vary based on your credit profile.

q5.question: What is the difference between fixed and variable rates?
q5.answer: Fixed rates remain constant for a set period, providing stability. Variable rates can change with market conditions, potentially offering lower initial rates but with less certainty. We can help you choose the option that best suits your needs.

q6.question: Can I make extra repayments on my loan?
q6.answer: This depends on your loan type. Variable rate loans typically allow extra repayments without penalty. Fixed rate loans may have restrictions or fees for extra repayments. We can explain the options available with different loan products.

faq.moreHelp: Still have questions? We are here to help.
